TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HtmlElementInsertionOrientation extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines values that describe where to insert a new element when using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.InsertAdjacentElement%2A>.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example inserts a `DIV` element into the top of every page that users view outside of the ADatum.com server. The example requires that your form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control named `WebBrowser1`. Your example must also import the namespace <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions>.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#9](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/HtmlElementProject/Form1.vb#9)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#9](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/HtmlElementProjectCSharp/Form1.cs#9)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElementInsertionOrientation AfterBegin = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Insert the element after the current element, but before all other content in the current element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElementInsertionOrientation AfterEnd = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Insert the element after the current element, but after all other content in the current element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElementInsertionOrientation BeforeBegin = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Insert the element before the current element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElementInsertionOrientation BeforeEnd = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Insert the element after the current element.
